intro: Heuffelia setacea, commonly known as the hairy heuffelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. It is native to regions of South America, particularly in countries like Argentina and Bolivia. Heuffelia setacea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands or open woodlands.
